paper_abstract: Erdos-Ko-Rado sets of planes in a projective or polar space are non-extendable sets of planes such that every two have a non-empty intersection. In this article we classify all ErdAs-Ko-Rado sets of planes that generate at least a 6-dimensional space. For general dimension (projective space) or rank (polar space) we give a classification of the ten largest types of ErdAs-Ko-Rado sets of planes. For some small cases we find a better, sometimes complete, classification.
paper_title: The largest Erdos-Ko-Rado sets of planes in finite projective and finite classical polar spaces
